items.description: Lower River Hull

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, Kingston upon Hull

items.message: River levels remain high in the Cottingham area. Further rain is forecast from the early hours of Monday morning 27/11/2023 and on Tuesday 28/11/2023, and levels are expected to rise further in the Cottingham area in response to this rain. We continue to monitor the forecast. Avoid using low-lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses, and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10am on 27/11/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Churn and its tributaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are high but stable on the River Churn as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, especially in the Cerney Wick area.  The weather forecast this evening, 26/11/23 and into tomorrow is for outbreaks of light rainfall. We expect river levels to continue to fall slowly over the next few days. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 27/11/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: River levels remain high on the Upper River Derwent around Low Marishes. River levels elsewhere on the Upper River Derwent continue to fall slowly. Further rain is forecast for Monday 27/11/2023 and Tuesday 28/11/2023, and levels are forecast to rise again in response to this rain. We are closely monitoring the forecast. Avoid using low-lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10am on 27/11/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. The weather forecast today, 26/11/23 is for outbreaks of rain. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: Lower Frome and tributaries
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
No property flooding is expected.
The forecast is for light rainfall for today.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

items.description: Aldingbourne and Barnham Rifes
items.message: The Aldingbourne Rife remains high, but is slowly falling. Minor flooding is still affecting caravans at Riverside Caravan Centre and Rowan Park Caravan Park. The Barnham Rife is also slowly falling. Minor flood impacts will continue in Bersted. Frontal rain is expected tomorrow (Sunday 26/11/2023) and on Monday (27/11/2023) but only minor flooding is expected. Water levels remain higher than normal and will rise again on Sunday. The Aldingbourne Rife might not return to normal until December. Some roads will be affected by flood water, please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding, including Shripney Lane. We are running our pumps at Felpham and keeping grilles clear to help reduce the risk of flooding. We will update this message by 19:00 26/11/2023.

items.description: River Thames and its small tributaries from Calcutt to Lechlade

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thames, Blunsdon Brook, Water Eaton Brook, Marston Meysey Brook, Share Ditch, Bydemill Brook, Westrop Brook, Downington Brook

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are high but falling gradually on the River Thames and small tributaries as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is possible. The weather forecast this evening, 26/11/23 and into tomorrow is for outbreaks of light rainfall. We expect river levels to continue to fall slowly over the next few days. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 27/11/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely from now, 9am on Sunday 26th November, and for at least the next 24 hours. Water levels continue to remain high in this area.  The forecast tides at Great Yarmouth will restrict the freshwater river drainage out to sea, resulting in higher than normal water levels within the Broads until the current high tides pass. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. The current series of high spring tides will continue for the next few days, and further warning messages may be issued. After the weekend the tides will start to fall away, allowing the freshwater river flows to drain out to sea at low tide as normal. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are closely monitoring the situation. We will update this message by 9am on Monday 27th November, or as the situation changes.

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels have fallen on the River Thame but remain high on the Chalgrove Brook as a result of previous heavy rainfall. We expect river levels to continue to fall slowly over the next few days. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 27/11/23, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message: River levels are continuing to fall slowly on the Lower River Derwent. This alert remains in force as levels are still high in the Elvington area and on Bielby Beck. Further rain is forecast for Monday 27/11/2023 and Tuesday 28/11/2023, and levels are forecast to rise again in response to this rain. We are closely monitoring the forecast. Please monitor local weather and river conditions and avoid contact with, walking or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10am on 27/11/2023, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
River levels are high but steady on the Middle and Lower Hampshire Avon due to raised groundwater levels.
No property flooding is expected.
No further rainfall is forecast.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 27/11/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Upper Og Valley
items.message:
Groundwater levels have responded to rainfall over the past few weeks and remain high at our observation borehole in Draycot Foliat in the Og Valley area. Groundwater levels are above normal for this time of year and remain at a level where communities may be affected by flooding from groundwater over the coming weeks. 

Levels are high but slowly falling in response to dry conditions over the past week, but levels remain responsive to further rainfall. Further rainfall is expected over the coming week with low confidence over exact locations and timings of rain. Groundwater levels will continue to remain high and may still impact low lying gardens and cellars. 

Due to the nature of groundwater behaviour, this situation could continue for several weeks or longer. We are continuing to monitor groundwater levels and will update this message by 01/12/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
The River Yeo level at Huish Episcopi Pumping Station is 7.90 m and is steady. The drain level is 7.43 m and continues to fall slowly.
Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.30 m, the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86 m, and the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93 m.
After a dry start, light to moderate rain is forecast later today, Sunday 26/11/2023, and early tomorrow. Tuesday and Wednesday are expected to be drier, with moderate rain on Thursday. The River Yeo will likely remain fairly high over the coming days due to pumping from the Moors, and the forecast rain. We continue to pump and operate the Parrett Flood Relief Channel as much as possible to evacuate water.
The situation is being monitored and staff are checking the condition of flood banks, spillways and weed screens. Please refer to @TravelSomerset for information on local road closures.
For water levels on the rivers, please refer to our website: (check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels).
This message will be updated by 15:00 on Monday 27/11/2023.

items.description: River Rye catchment
items.message: River levels are forecast to rise on the River Rye catchment due to rainfall expected from the early hours of Monday morning, 27/11/2023. Areas most at risk include land around the River Rye and it's tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck and Spittle Beck, including properties of Salton, Nunnington and Helmsley. Flooding is currently expected from around 7am to 9am onwards on Monday. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels closely. Consider acting on your flood plan if you have one. Avoid using low-lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10am on 27/11/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Slad Brook
items.message: River levels remain high due to rises at the Slad Steanbridge Lane river gauge as a result of recent heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid contact with flood water. This message will be updated by 10 am on Monday 27/11/23 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Creyke, Mill and Broadlane Becks at Cottingham
items.message: River levels in the Cottingham area have been rising slowly on Sunday 26/11/2023. This message has been re-sent to customers as levels may rise quickly on Creyke, Mill and Broadlane Becks at Cottingham from the early hours of Monday morning, 27/11/2023 onwards as rain is forecast during Monday and on Tuesday 28/11/2023. The area most at risk is properties around King Street, Northgate, Dunswell Road and North Moor Lane. We continue to monitor the forecast. Please take action to protect yourself and your property and monitor local weather and river conditions. Consider putting your flood plan into action and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. We will update this message by 10am on 27/11/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: River levels are now steadily falling, but still remain quite high in some locations. The forecast is for the high spring tides to remain for the next few days and rainfall forecast for Monday could see some increase in levels. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

The forecast is for the high spring tides to remain for the next few days. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.66mAOD at 02:00 on 27/11/23 and 4.77mAOD at 14:00 on 27/11/23.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is high for this time of year at 106 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain high for the next 2 days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 27/11/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in Hambledon
items.message: In Hambledon, groundwater levels are high and rising. Since 25/10/2023, 262mm of rain has been recorded in Worlds End. This is more than twice the average rainfall expected during that time. In the last 24 hours, the groundwater level at Whitedale Farm has risen by 20cm. From Sunday night (26/11/2023), levels may be high enough to affect a small number of cellars in Lower West Street, however the groundwater level may peak just before this occurs. The weather until Sunday is forecast to be dry. On Monday (27/11/2023) up to 25mm of rain is forecast in Hampshire. If heavy rain affects Hambledon, the groundwater level will continue to rise throughout next week. If not, then the level is expected to peak early next week and water could then recede from cellars in Lower West Street. We will continue to monitor the forecast. We are liaising with Hambledon Flood Action Group. Please remove any valuables from cellars, and if you use pumps to help reduce water levels, please ensure that they can operate. This Flood Alert will be updated by 17:00 on Wednesday 29/11/2023.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in Finchdean, Dean Lane End and Rowlands Castle
items.message: In Finchdean and Rowlands Castle, groundwater levels are high and rising. Since 25/10/23, 251mm of rain has been recorded in Walderton. This is more than twice the average amount expected during that period. In the last 24 hours, the groundwater level in Finchdean has increased by 30cm. From Sunday 26/11/23, the Idsworth Lavant is expected to be flowing through all villages. From Monday 27/11/23, it is possible pumps which prevent water from entering property may be required. Surface water could flood property during heavier rain events. However, there is a chance groundwater could peak below this impact level. Dry weather is forecast until Sunday 26/11/23. On Monday, up to 25mm of rain is forecast in Hampshire. If heavy rain affects the area, the groundwater level will continue to rise throughout next week. If not, then the level is expected to peak next week and water could begin receding. We are liaising with the Flood Action Group. If you use pumps to reduce water levels, please ensure that they can operate. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Thursday 30/11/23.
